pageContext.associations: Part of the well-known Plymouth Hoard, consisting of 16 celts, 3 daggers, 1 spear-head, and 1 narrow chisel.
pageContext.publications: Archaeological Journal XXVI, 346,Trans. Devonshire Association, No. 304,Evans, J., Anc. Bronze Implements, 50, 165, 241, 259, 464.
pageContext.collection: Exeter Museum,(No. 308),Presented 31 January 1870 by His Grace the Suke of Bedford, owner of the field.
pageContext.site: England,Devonshire,Plymstock,in a field called Rockt Parks, about 1 mile E. of Oreston, in the Cattewater, Plymouth Sound, 2 feet deep,24 October 1868
pageContext.toSearch: Plymstock, Plymouth, Plymouth, Plymouth Pl9, UK
pageContext.remarks: This hoard lay under a flat stone supposed to weigh between 3 and 4 cwt.
